zh-cn: 神日本磐余彦火火出见天皇

description.zh-cn: 日本传说中的第一代天皇，被尊为日本开国之祖。其真实性存在争议，但被记载于《古事记》和《日本书纪》中。
description.en: The legendary first Emperor of Japan, revered as the founder of the nation. His historicity is debated, but he is recorded in the Kojiki and Nihon Shoki.

description.zh-cn: 日本传说中的第二代天皇，神武天皇的第三皇子。
description.en: The legendary second Emperor of Japan, the third son of Emperor Jimmu.

zh-cn: 彦波潋武鸬鹚草葺不合尊

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，神武天皇的父亲。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, father of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，神武天皇的母亲，也是其父亲的姨母。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, mother of Emperor Jimmu and also his father's maternal aunt.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，事代主神之女，神武天皇的皇后。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, daughter of Kotoshironushi, and Empress of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，神武天皇的妃子。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, a consort of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，神武天皇的长兄，在神武东征中战死。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, the eldest brother of Emperor Jimmu, who died in battle during the Eastern Expedition.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，神武天皇的二哥，在神武东征中投海自尽。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, the second older brother of Emperor Jimmu, who died by entering the sea during the Eastern Expedition.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，神武天皇的三哥，在神武东征中投海自尽。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, the third older brother of Emperor Jimmu, who died by entering the sea during the Eastern Expedition.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，神武天皇的长子，企图谋害弟弟而被绥靖天皇杀死。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, the eldest son of Emperor Jimmu, who attempted to murder his younger brothers and was killed by Emperor Suizei.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，神武天皇的第二皇子。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, the second son of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 传说中由神武天皇建立的日本第一个统一王朝。
description.en: The first unified dynasty of Japan, said to have been founded by Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 神武天皇从日向国出发，向东征服大和地区的军事行动，是其建立大和朝廷的关键事件。
description.en: Emperor Jimmu's military campaign from Hyūga Province to conquer the Yamato region in the east, a key event leading to the establishment of the Yamato court.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，大和地区的土豪，抵抗神武天皇东征，后被栉玉饶速日命所杀。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, a local chieftain in the Yamato region who resisted Emperor Jimmu's eastern expedition and was later killed by Nigihayahi-no-mikoto.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，原为长髓彦所侍奉，后归顺神武天皇。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, initially served by Nagasunehiko, who later submitted to Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 秦朝方士，奉秦始皇之命出海寻找长生不老药。有一种说法认为他就是日本的神武天皇。
description.en: A court sorcerer of the Qin Dynasty, sent by Qin Shi Huang to seek the elixir of life. One theory suggests he was the same person as Japan's Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 中国第一位皇帝，派遣徐福出海寻找长生不老药。
description.en: The first emperor of China, who dispatched Xu Fu to search for the elixir of life.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，神武天皇的祖父。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, the grandfather of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，神武天皇的祖母，海童之大女。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, the grandmother of Emperor Jimmu, the elder daughter of the sea god Watatsumi.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的海神，丰玉姬与玉依姬的父亲。
description.en: The sea god in Japanese mythology, father of Toyotama-hime and Tamayori-hime.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的神祇，媛蹈鞴五十铃媛命的父亲。
description.en: A deity in Japanese mythology, father of Himetataraisuzuhime-no-mikoto.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中的人物，火折尊的兄长，吾平津媛的父亲。
description.en: A figure in Japanese mythology, the elder brother of Hoori and father of Ahiratsuhime.

description.zh-cn: 日本古代的令制国之一，位于现在的宫崎县。传说是神武天皇的出生地及其东征的起点。
description.en: An old province of Japan, now part of Miyazaki Prefecture. It is the legendary birthplace of Emperor Jimmu and the starting point of his eastern expedition.

description.zh-cn: 传说中神武天皇即位的皇居，以及其驾崩的地点。位于今奈良县橿原市。
description.en: The legendary palace where Emperor Jimmu ascended to the throne and later died. Located in modern-day Kashihara, Nara Prefecture.

description.zh-cn: 神武天皇是彦波潋武鸬鹚草葺不合尊的第四子。
description.en: Emperor Jimmu is the fourth son of Ugayafukiaezu.

description.zh-cn: 神武天皇是玉依姬的儿子。
description.en: Emperor Jimmu is the son of Tamayori-hime.

description.zh-cn: 鸬鹚草葺不合尊是火折尊（彦火火出见尊）的儿子。
description.en: Ugayafukiaezu is the son of Hoori (Hikohohodemi no Mikoto).

description.zh-cn: 鸬鹚草葺不合尊是丰玉姬的儿子。
description.en: Ugayafukiaezu is the son of Toyotama-hime.

description.zh-cn: 丰玉姬是海童的大女儿。
description.en: Toyotama-hime is the elder daughter of the sea god Watatsumi.

description.zh-cn: 玉依姬是海童的小女儿。
description.en: Tamayori-hime is the younger daughter of the sea god Watatsumi.

description.zh-cn: 彦五濑命是神武天皇的兄长。
description.en: Itsuse-no-mikoto is the elder brother of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 稻饭命是神武天皇的兄长。
description.en: Inai-no-mikoto is the elder brother of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 三毛入野命是神武天皇的兄长。
description.en: Mikeirino-no-mikoto is the elder brother of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 神武天皇于庚申年九月廿四日娶媛蹈鞴五十铃媛命为正妃，后立为皇后。
description.en: Emperor Jimmu married Himetataraisuzuhime-no-mikoto as his principal wife in the year Gengshen and later made her Empress.

description.zh-cn: 神武天皇纳吾平津媛为妃。
description.en: Emperor Jimmu took Ahiratsuhime as a consort.

description.zh-cn: 手研耳命是神武天皇的第一皇子。
description.en: Tagishimimi is the first son of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 手研耳命是吾平津媛的儿子。
description.en: Tagishimimi is the son of Ahiratsuhime.

description.zh-cn: 神八井耳命是神武天皇的第二皇子。
description.en: Kamuyai-mimi-no-mikoto is the second son of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 绥靖天皇是神武天皇的第三皇子。
description.en: Emperor Suizei is the third son of Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 媛蹈鞴五十铃媛命是事代主神之女。
description.en: Himetataraisuzuhime-no-mikoto is the daughter of Kotoshironushi.

description.zh-cn: 吾平津媛是火阑降命之女。
description.en: Ahiratsuhime is the daughter of Hoderi.

description.zh-cn: 火阑降命是火折尊的兄长。
description.en: Hoderi is the elder brother of Hoori.

description.zh-cn: 神武天皇于甲寅年（时年四十五岁）与诸皇兄、子商讨并率军东征。
description.en: In the year Jia-yin (at age 45), Emperor Jimmu discussed with his brothers and sons and led the eastern expedition.

description.zh-cn: 长髓彦率兵迎战东征的神武天皇。
description.en: Nagasunehiko led troops to fight against Emperor Jimmu during his eastern expedition.

description.zh-cn: 在与长髓彦的激战中，皇兄彦五濑命中流矢，后因此伤势过重而死。
description.en: During a fierce battle with Nagasunehiko, Emperor Jimmu's elder brother Itsuse-no-mikoto was hit by a stray arrow and later died from his wounds.

description.zh-cn: 栉玉饶速日命因长髓彦凶残不改，将其杀死。
description.en: Because Nagasunehiko remained ferocious and unchanged, Nigihayahi-no-mikoto killed him.

description.zh-cn: 栉玉饶速日命在杀死长髓彦后，追随神武天皇。
description.en: After killing Nagasunehiko, Nigihayahi-no-mikoto followed Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 神武天皇于神武天皇元年正月初一日（辛酉年）在橿原宫即位，建立大和朝廷。
description.en: On the first day of the first month of the first year of his reign (year of Shinyu), Emperor Jimmu ascended to the throne at Kashihara Palace, establishing the Yamato court.

description.zh-cn: 神武天皇三十二年，天皇立皇子神渟名川耳尊（绥靖天皇）为皇太子。
description.en: In the 32nd year of his reign, Emperor Jimmu appointed his son, Prince Kamu-nunakawa-mimi (Emperor Suizei), as the Crown Prince.

description.zh-cn: 手研耳命图谋加害两位弟弟，被神渟名川耳尊（绥靖天皇）杀死。
description.en: Tagishimimi plotted to harm his two younger brothers and was killed by Kamu-nunakawa-mimi (Emperor Suizei).

description.zh-cn: 徐福是秦朝方士，被秦始皇派遣出海寻找长生不老药。
description.en: Xu Fu was a court sorcerer of the Qin Dynasty, dispatched by Emperor Qin Shi Huang to search for the elixir of life.

description.zh-cn: 有一种学说认为，前往日本的徐福就是后来的神武天皇。
description.en: One theory suggests that Xu Fu, who traveled to Japan, later became Emperor Jimmu.

description.zh-cn: 神武天皇诞生于日向国。
description.en: Emperor Jimmu was born in Hyūga Province.
